jhelp.gui

Class JHelpRootPaneUI.MouseInputHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • jhelp.gui.JHelpRootPaneUI.MouseInputHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.MouseInputListener
    Enclosing class:
    JHelpRootPaneUI

     class JHelpRootPaneUI.MouseInputHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.event.MouseInputListener
    MouseInputHandler is responsible for handling resize/moving of the Window. It sets the cursor directly on the Window when then mouse moves over a hot spot.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int dragCursor
      Used to determine the corner the resize is occuring from.
      private int dragHeight
      Height of the window when the drag started.
      private int dragOffsetX
      X location the mouse went down on for a drag operation.
      private int dragOffsetY
      Y location the mouse went down on for a drag operation.
      private int dragWidth
      Width of the window when the drag started.
      private boolean isMovingWindow
      Set to true if the drag operation is moving the window.
      private java.awt.Cursor lastCursor
      Last cursor to return

        Adjust bounds for a modification
        Parameters:
        bounds - Bounds to adjust
        min - Minimum size
        deltaX - Translation on X
        deltaY - Translation on Y
        deltaWidth - How width change
        deltaHeight - How height change

      • calculateCorner

        private int calculateCorner(java.awt.Window w,
                  int x,
                  int y)
        Returns the corner that contains the point x, y, or -1 if the position doesn't match a corner.
        Parameters:
        w - Reference window
        x - X location
        y - Y location
        Returns:
        Calculated corner

      • calculatePosition

        private int calculatePosition(int spot,
                    int width)
        Returns an integer indicating the position of spot in width. The return value will be: 0 if < BORDER_DRAG_THICKNESS 1 if < CORNER_DRAG_WIDTH 2 if >= CORNER_DRAG_WIDTH && < width - BORDER_DRAG_THICKNESS 3 if >= width - CORNER_DRAG_WIDTH 4 if >= width - BORDER_DRAG_THICKNESS 5 otherwise
        Parameters:
        spot - Spot
        width - Width
        Returns:
        The position

      • getCursor

        private int getCursor(int corner)
        Returns the Cursor to render for the specified corner. This returns 0 if the corner doesn't map to a valid Cursor
        Parameters:
        corner - Considered corner
        Returns:
        The cursor

        Parameters:

        Returns:
